article-list.title: Test Article Paper Bag Puppets
article-list.author: Lindsey C.
article-list.body: Create your own paper bag puppet animals and put on a puppet show this summer! Simply choose your favorite animal and use construction paper, markers and glue to make each paper bag puppet come to life. Ella and Annie have provided you with some ideas for a cat, lizard, panda, pig and giraffe! Need a stage for your puppets to perform? Check out how to make your very own puppet theater.
article-list.otc_featured_products: what products the blogger will be using in the article.

article_list_content.field_list_content: Create this cuddly cat puppet using our large kraft bags; these bags are more durable and larger than a paper lunch sack and will last multiple puppet shows! To create our kitty cat puppet you will need construction paper, pom poms, googly eyes and glue. Each cat can be different; choose from a variety of colors and make sure to add little details, like spots!

This lazy lizard makes the perfect puppet pet! Boys, hold off on catching those lizards in your yard! Create our silly lizard puppet with kraft paper bags, construction paper, googly eyes, markers and glue. Add fun details such as a curly-q tounge! Did you know that some lizards change colors due to the reflection of light? Make lizards in a variety of colors for fun!

Don't you just love our perfect panda puppet? The panda puppet is super easy to make and pretty stinkin cute! Create our panda puppet using durable kraft bags, construction paper, googly eyes and glue. Try adding white felt to make a fuzzy panda tummy! Your panda can almost double as a raccoon puppet, right?

How cute is our Geoffry the giraffe puppet? Create this darling giraffe puppet using kraft paper bags, construction paper, googly eyes, stencils and glue. It is pretty clear that giraffes are one of the most adorable animals ever; according to my kids. Have you visited your local zoo to see a real giraffe?

Our piggy puppet is too cute for words and really easy to put together. Create this little piggy with kraft paper bags, felt, construction paper, markers, googly eyes and glue. Use patterned scrapbook paper to make clothes for each pig and let your kids put on a puppet show to tell the story of the three little pigs!

metainformation.seoDescription: Create your own paper bag puppet animals and put on a puppet show this summer! Simply choose your favorite animal and craft away!

fun365recipe.title: Mini Naked Cakes -- Test
fun365recipe.author: Kaelin Zawilinski
fun365recipe.body: I'm in love with naked cakes. They're so elegant yet they have that homemade, rustic loveliness I adore. There's no need to spend a fortune on cakes from the bakery or spend hours in the kitchen baking them yourself. With this quick and easy mini naked cake recipe, you'll be in and out of the kitchen in no time with beautiful, rustic-chic cakes. Treat your guests to their own mini desserts that are as lovely as they are scrumptious!
fun365recipe.field_meta_description: Meta description text would go here.

Project.title: Test Project SW
Project.author: Lindsey L Crotty
Project.body: These pots are full of personality, easy to make and will be the perfect addition to any spring garden or patio. This would also be a fun gift idea for Mother's Day that would be great for kids or tweens to make. I swear by these fabulous paint markers! They are super easy to work with and dry super fast. Give them a go! The craft is also suitable for kids 7 and older. Ella loves her emojis!

project_step_data.field_description: Paint 2-3 coats of yellow acrylic paint on the ceramic flower pots. Allow pots to dry completely.

Decide on which emoji faces you would like to create. Pick out the paint markers you will need. Make sure to shake up each marker before use. You will need to press down on the tip of the markers to allow it to fill with paint. Repeat as needed.

Ella and Annie wanted to make the "love" emoji with the heart eyes. We used a red and black paint pen. Trace the outline of the heart eyes and mouth. Then gently press the marker to release paint to fill in the eyes and mouth.

The second flower pot was the "kiss" emoji. Perfect for when mom blows kisses! You will also need the red and black paint pen for this flower pot. Repeat these steps with each emoji face you decide to make. Allow the flower pots to dry.

metainformation.seoDescription: Test Skyword meta description field. This is SEO optimized text that helps in ranking.

article-list.title: Test Article List SW
article-list.author: Lindsey L Crotty
article-list.body: Bright blooms, chirping birds, fuzzy caterpillars — the kids' spring craft ideas are endless! Perfect for a rainy day or weekend afternoon, these spring craft ideas for kids will infuse your home with cheerful spring color. We've rounded up our favorite kids' spring craft ideas for you to try with your little ones!

article_list_content.field_list_content: Adorn your fridge with cute, not-at-all-creepy crawlies! This kids' spring craft is equal parts adorable and functional — they're perfect for displaying other art projects. See how Shauna from Ella and Annie brought basic clothespins to life using items like pom-poms and googly eyes, along with a complete list of supplies. they're perfect for displaying other art projects. See how Shauna from Ella and Annie brought basic clothespins to life using items like pom-poms and googly eyes, along with a complete list of supplies.

While terrariums are traditionally filled with live plants and ceramic figurines, the plastic container, craft sand, and butterfly and dinosaur figurines in this DIY version are totally kid-proof. See how Shauna of Ella and Annieput together two equally adorable versions and get the complete supply list. they're perfect for displaying other art projects. See how Shauna from Ella and Annie brought basic clothespins to life using items like pom-poms and googly eyes, along with a complete list of supplies. they're perfect for displaying other art projects. Help your kids create the perfect container to plant their first seeds this spring! Shauna from Ella and Annie used Dip and Dot Paint Dotters to create the caterpillar's body, then used paint pens to add fun designs. they're perfect for displaying other art projects. See how Shauna from Ella and Annie they're perfect for displaying other art projects. See how Shauna from Ella and Annie brought basic clothespins to life using items like pom-poms and googly eyes, along with a complete list of supplies. they're perfect for displaying other art projects. See how Shauna from Ella and Annie brought basic clothespins to life using items like pom-poms and googly eyes, along with a complete list of supplies.

Those April showers are inevitable — but your kiddos can get through them in style! This ultimate spring kids' craft uses an umbrella as a blank canvas for them to express their creativity. Offer fabric paint, fabric spray paint, and washi tape, and let their imaginations run wild. See how blogger Meri Cherry set up this activity they're perfect for displaying other art projects. article.title: Test SW Article Pineapple Party
article.author: Lindsey L Crotty
article.body: Summer will be here before we know it and it's time to start planning your summer parties. Pineapples are all the rage right now. They are fun for kids and adults alike. I didn't want the kids to be having all the fun, so I created an elegant and stylish Pineapple Cocktail Bar for the adults to enjoy too. Take your parties from ordinary to extraordinary with a few simple steps. I selected sophisticated items that I knew my girlfriends would love. Sticking with a color palette of pinks, shades of teal, golden yellow, and a variety of green tones.

carousel.field_carousel_heading: Happy Hour All Day Every Day
carousel.field_carousel_content: All of my drinks required pineapple juice, so I filled the Glass Beverage Dispenser with ice and lots of pineapple juice. Plus, if you have a guest who is pregnant or not drinking alcohol, they can still participate since guests will be adding in their own alcohol. Stock your bar with all of your favorite alcohol. Using vodka, rum, flavored vodka, and a few unique liqueurs you can create the ultimate DIY drink bar.

imagewide_content.headline: DIY Bar Cart & Tumblers
imagewide_content.body_copy: The Tropical Leaves and Large Palm Leaves were one of my favorite items to use throughout this party. I used them on my DIY Bar Bunting Bannerand as tray liners on all of my trays and on the bar cart. It was a quick and easy way to add in color and to be more tropical. A pineapple party wouldn't be complete without these adorable, two-piece Ceramic Pineapple Tumblers. I am just in love with these golden little beauties. Fill them with your favorite cocktails and you can drink them with or without the lid. Either way, they are cute and functional.

bodycontent.articlecontent: I always think a few simple sweets are the perfect addition to any party. Kyra, of Kyra's Bake Shop created these darling tropical leaf and pineapple cookies, along with the most darling flamingo topped cupcakes. Adding in simple desserts that match your theme is always appreciated by your guests. Plus. they look incredible on these Light Pink Dessert Plates.

imagetall_container.bodycopy: I couldn't resist the Tiki Tumblers. Tiki decorations are a must have at any party and were the perfect compliment at this party. We even created a Tiki Chata drink named after them.

metainformation.seoDescription: Summer will be here before we know it and it's time to start planning your summer parties. This pineapple party idea is a perfect way to celebrate outdoors

fun365recipe.title: Test SW Recipe Coconut Pineapple Milkshake
fun365recipe.author: Lindsey L Crotty
fun365recipe.body: The summer season is upon us and we're getting ready for lots of outdoor tropical celebrations! If you saw the Bright Luau Party I recently styled, you may have seen the cute Ceramic Pineapple Tumblers with Lids among the delicious spread of fruit, cupcakes and coconut cake. We also enjoyed Coconut Pineapple Milkshakes! In my opinion, nothing pairs better than coconut and pineapple, so naturally I'm excited to share my favorite milkshake recipe with you.
fun365recipe.field_ingredients: 1 Cup Milk, 2 Cups Vanilla Ice Cream, 20 oz. Can Pineapple Chunks, 1/2 Cup Shredded Coconut, 1/3 Cup Crushed Ice

field_step.field_description: Combine the milk, ice cream, pineapple and coconut in the blender and blend for 30 seconds.
Add the crushed ice and blend until smooth. Add the crushed ice and blend until smooth.

Pour into the Ceramic Pineapple Tumblers with Lids. Pour into the Ceramic Pineapple Tumblers with Lids. Pour into the Ceramic Pineapple Tumblers with Lids. Pour into the Ceramic Pineapple Tumblers with Lids.

Project.title: SW - Pom Pom Branches
Project.author: Lindsey C.
Project.body: This spring season, it's time to set your front door apart from the rest of the neighborhood! Instead of pulling that same dusty floral-topped wreath out of storage for the eighth year in a row, try making your own version of our DIY burlap wreath with floating butterflies. This project is easily customized to your home's color scheme, and really takes just 20 minutes to craft—with no messy glue involved either. Read on for the DIY details!<script async type="text/javascript" src="//tracking.skyword.com/tracker.js?contentId=281474979629987"></script>

project_step_data.field_description: Choose a Pom-Pom color scheme for your DIY petaled branches. The particular branches pictured in this tutorial showcase a natural palette of soft green, white, yellow and pink, but you may choose instead to go with a more saturated or vibrant scheme. A few ideas for alternate looks—including a citrus vibe, grape palette and bold hot pink combination—are below.

Lay your cut tree branch out on a clean, flat work surface. Play around with different Pom-Pom placements by laying them along the branches without using glue. Keep in mind that a natural tree branch features buds that get progressively smaller towards the ends if you're hoping to get a natural look. Using a small handful of pom poms rather than a big pile of them will also make your branches look

Once you're satisfied with your branch design and color palette, carefully pick up your first Pom Pom, and squeeze a dot of Aleene's Original Tacky Glue right onto the fibers of the pom pom. Hold the pom pom between your fingers without touching the glue for 30 seconds to allow the adhesive to go from a runny consistency to more tacky in texture. Then, gently press the pom pom onto the tree branch

Continue gluing the individual pom poms to the tree branch using the instructions in Step 3. It's okay if a few of the heavier pom poms slip slightly off the branch after a minute or so. Simply re-press the pom pom to the branch and it will eventually stick for good. The glue will dry clear, so feel free to use as much glue as necessary to get your pom poms to attach fully to the branch.

Allow the finished pom pom design to dry on the branch (or branches) for at least 1 hour before handling. Then, gently place your finished DIY Pom-Pom Petaled Live Cut Branches into a Large Cylinder Glass Vase. You may choose to leave the vase empty save for the branches, or you can fill the negative space with small rocks, pebbles or sand. After that, you're all ready to style the finished decora

Project.field_meta_keywords: pom pom craft, pom pom diy

article-list.title: 5 GREAT DIY WEDDING IDEAS
article-list.author: John Dillick
article-list.body: When it comes to DIY weddings, you can be as creative as far as your talents will stretch, or if they are minimal, then why not check out some simple online guides to learn new ideas and techniques. YouTube and Pinterest are both great sources of ideas and inspiration and both sites are completely free, easy and simple to use.<script async type="text/javascript" src="//tracking.skyword.com/tracker.js?contentId=281474979619458"></script>

article_list_content.field_list_content: Make guests immediately feel at ease with a heart felt sign and one that also gives clear instructions or directions, so as not to confuse them. This can easily be done through leftover wooden crates or cheap chalkboards. Here's a few simple ideas you can recreate in your own way.

If you want something quick and simple then mason jars are always a backup plan, they look elegant and stylish and all you need is some water, tea-lights and ribbon or twine to decorate the neck. Or perhaps you could try floral or heart shaped garlands, they are really easy and fun to make, just ask some of your maids over for wine and snacks whilst you conjure up some decorative drapes and chat about the impending wedding day.

Project-Lite.title: WASHI TAPE CLOTHESPIN EARBUD IDEA
Project-Lite.author: John Dillick
Project-Lite.body: Are you looking for a cool way to keep those earbud wires organized? Try including this Washi Tape Clothespin Tidy Idea to your craft supplies. Using that DIY side of your brain, follow the directions below to create a method of keeping your earbuds and all those crazy wires free and untangled! Give the finished product as a cool Easter, birthday or Mother's Day gift! Or, keep it all to yourself and enjoy your worry-free music experience!<script async type="text/javascript" src="//tracking.skyword.com/tracker.js?contentId=281474979621264"></script>

project_step_data.field_description: Glue the clothespins together so that the clip part of the clothespins are on each side.
Adhere a strip of Washi tape to the top of the clothespins. Use a craft knife to cut off the excess tape. Download the template PDF!

Project-Lite.field_meta_description: Are you looking for a cool way to keep those earbud wires organized? Try including this Washi Tape Clothespin Tidy Idea to your craft supplies. Using that DIY side of your brain, follow the directions below to create a method of keeping your earbuds and all those crazy wires free and untangled! Give the finished product as a cool Easter, birthday or Mother's Day gift! Or, keep it all to yourself and enjoy your worry-free music experience!

Project.title: DIY MINI VALENTINE TREAT BAGS
Project.author: John Dillick
Project.body: I love these mini kraft bags! They are perfect for a bite-sized treat. Each little package can be unique with a variety of Valentine stickers and sweet treats.<script async type="text/javascript" src="//tracking.skyword.com/tracker.js?contentId=281474979619455"></script>

project_step_data.field_description: Start by placing the sunflower seed packet into the mini kraft bags. You will need to fold the side of the sunflower seed bag to get it to fit into the kraft bag.
Using a small piece of washi tape, fold over the top of the mini kraft bag and seal it. Cut a piece of baker's twine and tie the twine around the bag as you would ribbon and tie a bow.

fun365recipe.title: MARINATED AVOCADO & PEAR SALAD
fun365recipe.author: Tester Extraordinaire
fun365recipe.body: Every luncheon can use a good salad and this one is really, really good. The recipe comes from a neighbor of mine who is a very talented cook and this salad is a crowd-pleaser with a unique twist– marinated avocados and pears. I recently served it at my baby's first birthday "Flamingle" and along with some chicken salad sandwiches, fresh fruit, and cake, it was the perfect early spring luncheon menu.<script async type="text/javascript" src="//tracking.skyword.com/tracker.js?contentId=281474979615839"></script>
fun365recipe.otc_featured_products: Quick ViewMini Kraft Bags Quick ViewValentine Sunflower Seed Packets Quick ViewBaker's Twine

field_step.field_description: STEP 1 Start by preparing the avocado and cutting into bite-sized chunks. Put into a zip-loc bag and cover with some of the salad dressing, until just covered.

STEP 2 Do the same with the pears, removing skin and cutting into bite sized chunks, then placing in plastic bag and covering lightly with dressing. This will not only give the pears and avocados flavor, but the vinegar prevents them from browning.
STEP 3 While those marinate, assemble the rest of your salad, topping the lettuce mix with the onion, cheese, bacon, and nuts then finally topping with the pears and avocados.Toss lightly.
STEP 4 You can add a bit of additional dressing if desired, but the dressing in the pears and avocados will be a good starting base.
STEP 5 Serve and enjoy this delightful salad! It's so yummy!

fun365recipe.title: MARINATED AVOCADO & PEAR SALAD
fun365recipe.author: John Dillick
fun365recipe.body: Every luncheon can use a good salad and this one is really, really good. The recipe comes from a neighbor of mine who is a very talented cook and this salad is a crowd-pleaser with a unique twist– marinated avocados and pears. I recently served it at my baby's first birthday "Flamingle" and along with some chicken salad sandwiches, fresh fruit, and cake, it was the perfect early spring luncheon menu.<script async type="text/javascript" src="//tracking.skyword.com/tracker.js?contentId=281474979621253"></script>

field_step.field_description: Start by preparing the avocado and cutting into bite-sized chunks. Put into a zip-loc bag and cover with some of the salad dressing, until just covered.

Do the same with the pears, removing skin and cutting into bite sized chunks, then placing in plastic bag and covering lightly with dressing. This will not only give the pears and avocados flavor, but the vinegar prevents them from browning.

The recipe comes from a neighbor of mine who is a very talented cook and this salad is a crowd-pleaser with a unique twist– marinated avocados and pears. I recently served it at my baby's first birthday "Flamingle" and along with some chicken salad sandwiches, fresh fruit, and cake, it was the perfect early spring luncheon menu.

article.title: SUGAR PLUM FAIRY PARTY
article.author: Tester Extraordinaire
article.body: There are all different kinds of parties and gatherings during the holiday season– family parties, and work parties, and neighborhood parties. But there wasn't really a party geared towards my little girl and her friends. She is in ballet class and we took her to see The Nutcracker for the first time this year, which she watched in complete awe and fascination. She was dancing in the isles and her favorite part of the production was the Sugar Plum Fairy. That gave me an idea: a Sugar Plum Fairy themed ballerina party for her and her friends during Christmastime.<script async type="text/javascript" src="//tracking.skyword.com/tracker.js?contentId=281474979609635"></script>
article.field_meta_keywords: party supplies, party favors, party decorations, Halloween costumes, birthday party supplies, party ideas, novelties, crafts, candy, small toys, balloons, scrapbook supplies, beads, arts and crafts, crafts for kids
